DOC.HEAD: Helicopter Crash Kills Five Near Biggin Hill Aerodrome
DOC.TEXT: A chartered helicopter crashed in bad weather near an aerodrome south of London on Monday, killing all five people aboard, firefighters said. The Bell Jet Ranger helicopter came down at Bottom Barn Farm in Berry's Hill near the aerodrome, a Fire Brigade spokeswoman said. ``Five bodies have been located,'' said the spokeswoman, who was not identified. Biggin Hill aerodrome director Keith Waud said the owners, Starline Helicopters, were a maintenance and charter firm based at the aerodrome. He said there had been low cloud, blustery conditions, light rain and poor visibility when the helicopter took off. ``They encountered bad weather and in the process of returning lost radio communications,'' Waud said. ``Observers on the ground reported that the aircraft had crashed.'' The Civil Aviation Authority said the Air Accidents Investigation Branch of the Department of Transport had been informed and would be investigating.
